intro: Aegiphila bracteolosa, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale purple or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Aegiphila bracteolosa is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas.
